attributes.action: Prevent employers from claiming IP rights to works produced in an employee's spare time
attributes.additional_details:
In some industries, like software, employees often like to work on side-projects in their spare time. However, employers sometimes take ownership of them by writing a clause into an employee's contract.

http://answers.onstartups.com/questions/19422/if-im-working-at-a-company-do-they-have-intellectual-property-rights-to-the-st

High-tech startups are likely to form an important part of the UK's future economy, and these often start off as side-projects. But some employees are prevented from doing this, due to the clauses.

California has a law that states that anything employees do on their own time that isn't related to their employers' line of work is theirs. I propose that the UK passes a similar law.
